DOC.brief_summary: Temporary pacing via femoral vein is used widely in mainland China, because of its feasibility and simplicity. However, pulmonary embolism often occurred after the procedure. It is not known that whether there was any difference in incidence of pulmonary embolism between via different approaches. This randomized and multi-center study was designed to verify whether temporary pacing via subclavian vein has lower incidence than via femoral vein.
DOC.brief_title: Incidence of Pulmonary Embolism During Temporary Pacing Via Femoral Versus Subclavian Vein
DOC.criteria: 18 years old or older There is indication for temporary pacing Patients agreed to participate in the clinical trial and sign a written informed consent History of pulmonary embolism or deep vein thrombosis Devices existing in vein system Patients who could not receive randomization Severe coagulation disorder Severe liver, kidney dysfunction Mental diseases Pregnancy Patients investigators believed not suitable for enrollment
